meta.description: High-resolution land use and land cover map for European functional urban areas, providing detailed classification of urban and peri-urban zones for the 2018 reference year. The dataset supports fine-scale analysis of urban morphology, spatial planning, and land use change monitoring across major European cities.

attribution.text: Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) – Urban Atlas, European Environment Agency (EEA)

categories.label: Discontinuous very low density urban fabric (S.L. < 10%)
Industrial, commercial, public, military and private units
Fast transit roads and associated land

meta.description: Land cover map for 2021

A pan-European spatially consistent and seamless, detailed land cover inventory for the 2021 reference year, for each pixel showing the dominant land cover among the 11 basic land cover classes. The dataset is available as 10 m raster.
20 m classification of sealing increase, decrease or stability between 2018 and 2021

attribution.text: Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) – High Resolution Layer Imperviousness Change 2018–2021

meta.description: Provides pan-European binary information on built-up areas at 10 m spatial resolution for the 2021 reference year. Built-up areas correspond to artificial above-ground constructions (e.g. buildings) within the sealing outline derived from the Imperviousness Density 2021 layer.

attribution.text: Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) – HRL Non-Vegetated Land Cover Characteristics (Built-Up 2021), data service by GeoVille

meta.description: Buildings with green roof installations, supporting analysis of nature-based solutions and urban heat mitigation.

attribution.text: Brockmann Consult – xcube GeoDB / Copernicus Urban Data

meta.description: A global level spatial information on different types (classes) of physical coverage of the Earth's surface, e.g. forests, grasslands, croplands, lakes, wetlands for the 2019 base year. The data are updated annually and are available for the 2015-2019 years.

ECOSTRESS instrument mounted on the International Space Station. Data shows land surface temperatures measured during early afternoon hours in °C. The map is composed of single observations acquired between June 1st to June 24th, in order to result in an almost cloud-free image.
Soil Organic Carbon content in the 0-20 cm top soil expressed in g kg-1 for 100 m resolution pixels (2020-2022).
Soil Organic Carbon content in the 0-20 cm top soil expressed in g kg-1 for 100 m resolution pixels (2018-2020)

This swipe layer enables a side-by-side comparison of Soil Organic Carbon (SOC) content in the 0–20 cm topsoil layer across Europe, with 2018 displayed on the left and 2020 on the right. The product is derived from WorldSoils SOC estimates based on ESA Sentinel-2 composites and ancillary data, supporting visual assessment of spatial differences in topsoil carbon content between the two reference years.

attribution.text: European Space Agency (ESA) – WorldSoils SOC product

sources.name: Soil Water Index (SWI) – Europe (1 km, daily, 2015–present)

meta.description: Quantifies the moisture condition at various depths in the soil. Daily observations are available for the continental Europe in the spatial resolution of 1 km and with the temporal extent from January 2015 to present.

sources.name: Surface Soil Moisture 2014-present (raster 1km), Europe, daily - version 1

meta.description: Provides information on the relative water content of the top few centimeters soil, describing how wet or dry the soil is in its topmost layer, expressed in percent saturation. Daily observations are available for the continental Europe in the spatial resolution of 1 km and with the temporal extent from October 2014 to present.

sources.name: Fraction of Green Vegetation Cover 2014-present (raster 300 m), global, 10-daily – version 1

meta.description: Corresponds to the fraction of ground covered by green vegetation. It quantifies the spatial extent of the vegetation. Every 10-days estimates are available in near real time at global scale in the spatial resolution of about 300 m from January 2014 to June 2020 based upon PROBA-V data with version 1.0 and from July 2020 onwards based upon Sentinel-3/OLCI data with version 1.1.

sources.name: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation 2016-present (raster 10 m), Europe, daily

meta.description: Provides at pan-European level and in near real time daily updates of the fraction of the solar radiation absorbed by live leaves for the photosynthesis activity. The data are available at 10 m x 10 m spatial resolution with the temporal extent from October 2016 to present.

sources.name: Leaf Area Index 2016-present (raster 10 m), Europe, daily

meta.description: Defined as half of the total area of green elements of the canopy per unit horizontal ground area daily updates of Leaf Area Index are provided at pan-European level and in near real time. The data are available at 10 m x 10 m spatial resolution with the temporal extent from October 2016 to present.

sources.name: Normalised Difference Vegetation Index 2016-present (raster 10 m), Europe, daily

meta.description: Describes the difference between visible and near infrared reflectance of vegetation cover. Daily updates of Normalised Difference Vegetation Index are provided at pan-European level and in near real time. The data are available at 10 m x 10 m spatial resolution with the temporal extent from October 2016 to present.
True colour composite of 2021 Sentinel 2 data.

attribution.text: NASA via EOC Base Map Service from DLR
© CNES, Distribution Airbus DS, © Airbus DS, © PlanetObserver (Contains Copernicus Data) | © Stadia Maps © OpenMapTiles © OpenStreetMap

meta.description: Percentage of tree canopy cover per pixel at 10 m resolution, ranging from 0–100%, representing the vertical projection of tree crowns onto the ground.

attribution.text: Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) – High Resolution Layer Tree Cover Density

meta.description: This Tree Cover Presence Change layer maps areas with tree cover loss or gain between the reference years 2018 and 2021 at 20m resolution and with Minimum Mapping Unit of 1ha.

attribution.text: Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) – High Resolution Layers

meta.description: The Dominant Leaf Type (DLT) layer provides a basic land cover classification with 3 thematic classes (all non-tree covered areas / broadleaved / coniferous) at 10m spatial resolution.

attribution.text: Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) – High Resolution Layers

meta.description: Herbaceous Cover 2023 is a Copernicus High Resolution Layer providing a 10 m land cover classification distinguishing herbaceous and non-herbaceous surfaces across Europe. The product is derived from harmonised probability layers based on Sentinel-2 observations and supports the monitoring of green surfaces in urban and peri-urban areas.

attribution.text: Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) – High Resolution Layers

meta.description: Digital Surface Model (DSM) at 10 m spatial resolution derived from Copernicus elevation data, representing the elevation of natural and built features such as buildings, trees and terrain. This tile covers the Granollers area and is suitable for analysing urban morphology, landform influence on heat distribution, and terrain–temperature interactions in UHI studies.

attribution.text: European Space Agency (ESA) / Copernicus Programme – Copernicus DEM (DSM 10 m)

meta.description: Land Surface Temperature (LST) derived from Sentinel-3 SLSTR, provided by Terrascope as a time-enabled WMS layer. The dataset offers daily surface temperature estimates useful for monitoring urban heat, identifying hotspots, and analysing heatwave intensity. Temporal browsing allows viewing temperature evolution over time.

attribution.text: Terrascope / VITO – Sentinel-3 SLSTR LST Service

sources.name: Global Land Surface Temperature – Daily Max

meta.description: Global Land Surface Temperature (LST) product from the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS), version 2, provided as a WMTS layer. It represents the daily maximum of the LST cycle, aggregated into 10-daily composites at 5 km resolution. This dataset supports global and regional analysis of heat extremes, heatwave monitoring, and large-scale thermal patterns.

attribution.text: Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) – Global Land Service

sources.name: Global Thermal Condition Index – Daily Max

meta.description: Global Thermal Condition Index (TCI) from the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS), derived from Land Surface Temperature (LST) and provided as a WMTS layer. This product represents the daily maximum thermal stress conditions, delivered as 10-daily composites at 5 km resolution. The dataset is suitable for detecting heat anomalies, monitoring heatwaves and analysing global-to-regional thermal stress patterns.

attribution.text: Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) – Global Land Service

meta.description: WSF Evolution provides the estimated year when built-up areas first emerged, derived from long-term Landsat archives.

attribution.text: © DLR (German Aerospace Center) – World Settlement Footprint Program

sources.name: European-wide Growing Stock Volume (GSV) – FCM 100 m

meta.description:
Growing Stock Volume (GSV) expresses the total volume of living tree biomass (solid wood) per unit area.
This layer is produced at 100 m spatial resolution using the Forest Classification Model (FCM), combining Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2, and auxiliary datasets to map tree cover and forest structure across Europe.

attribution.text: © European Space Agency (ESA), Forest Classification Model (FCM) – Growing Stock Volume 2020

meta.description: High-resolution Land Surface Temperature (LST) derived via the CHILL-y downscaling framework, applied to Sentinel-3 SLSTR thermal data. This raster represents surface radiant temperature at ~10–30 m resolution for the overpass on 13 August 2024.

attribution.text: © ESA – CHILL-y LST Downscaling Consortium (Sentinel-3 SLSTR LST)

meta.description: Multisensor EO-derived 2024 LULC map for the Port of Rotterdam, supporting classification of port, industrial, urban, and coastal land-cover classes.

sources.name: WSF Global Built-up at 10 m - 2015 l 2019

meta.description:
Global 10 m built-up layers derived from multisensor satellite data for the reference years 2015 and 2019.
These datasets map human-made structures at high resolution and support urban expansion analysis, infrastructure monitoring, and settlement mapping.
Global 90 m building volume layer derived from TanDEM-X and optical data, providing m³ estimates of urban structure and density.
Global 90 m average building height derived from TanDEM-X and optical data, supporting analysis of vertical urban structure.
Rooftop footprints for major Austrian cities, supporting urban morphology and building-scale spatial analysis.

attribution.text: Brockmann Consult – xcube GeoDB (Austria Rooftops Dataset)

meta.description: This layer represents rooftop photovoltaic (PV) potential across Austria, aggregated by federal state, and produced within the GTIF framework to support energy planning and urban infrastructure analysis.
